story.text: LONDON Jan 2 European stocks opened 2007 higher on Tuesday, with trading expected to remain thin immediately after the year-end break and due to a U.S. holiday to mourn a former president, Gerald Ford. The FTSEurofirst 300 .FTEU3 index of top European shares rose 0.44 percent in early trade to 1,489.94 points. Among national indexes, the UK's FTSE 100 .FTSE rose 0.5 percent, and Germany's DAX .GDAXI and France's CAC 40 were both up around 0.7 percent. The start of trading in Milan .SPMIB was delayed due to technical problems.
story.title: european shares open 2007 higher
